qas.question: The Ottoman Empire is also known as what three other names?

answers.text: Turkish Empire, Ottoman Turkey or Turkey

qas.question: When was the Ottoman empire founded?
Where was the Ottoman empire founded?
Conquests by who began the transformation of the Ottoman sultanate into an Empire?

context: The Ottoman Empire (/ˈɒtəmən/; Ottoman Turkish: دَوْلَتِ عَلِيّهٔ عُثمَانِیّه‎ Devlet-i Aliyye-i Osmâniyye, Modern Turkish: Osmanlı İmparatorluğu or Osmanlı Devleti), also known as the <a0_0>Turkish Empire, Ottoman Turkey or Turkey<a0_0/>, was an empire founded in <a1_0>1299<a1_0/> by <a2_0>Oghuz Turks<a2_0/> under Osman I in <a3_0>northwestern Anatolia<a3_0/>. After conquests in the Balkans by <a4_0>Murad I<a4_0/> between 1362 and 1389, the Ottoman sultanate was transformed into a transcontinental empire and claimant to the caliphate. The Ottomans ended the Byzantine Empire with the 1453 conquest of Constantinople by Mehmed the Conqueror.
